intro: Miconia sparsisetulosa, commonly known as the sparsely toothed miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves with a distinctive serrated margin. It produces clusters of small, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Miconia sparsisetulosa is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
